stlib.datatypes.spatial.util

Class Segment

  • java.lang.Object
    • stlib.datatypes.spatial.util.Segment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Spatial, SegmentIF
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Halfsegment

    public class Segment
extends java.lang.Object
implements SegmentIF
    Class to represent segment objects, generally used for representing the spatial line objects
    Author:
    Markus Fuessel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean defined
      The defined flag, indicates if a data type object is defined
      private PointIF leftPoint
      Left endpoint of this segment
      private PointIF rightPoint
      Right endpoint of this segment

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Segment()
      Constructor for a empty and undefined 'Segment' object.
      Segment(double x0, double y0, double x1, double y1)
      Constructor for an 'Segment' object
      The passed coordinates will be assigned to the internal leftPoint and rightPoint by the following rule:
      leftPoint = min(Point(x0, y0), Point(x1, y1))
      rightPoint = max(Point(x0, y0), Point(x1, y1))
      Segment(PointIF p0, PointIF p1)
      Constructor for an 'Segment' object
      The passed points will be assigned to the internal leftPoint and rightPoint by the following rule:
      leftPoint = min(p0, p1)
      rightPoint = max(p0, p1)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Segment

        public Segment()
        Constructor for a empty and undefined 'Segment' object.
        Should not normally be used

      • Segment

        public Segment(PointIF p0,
               PointIF p1)
        Constructor for an 'Segment' object
        The passed points will be assigned to the internal leftPoint and rightPoint by the following rule:
        leftPoint = min(p0, p1)
        rightPoint = max(p0, p1)
        Parameters:
        p0 - - first endpoint
        p1 - - second endpoint

      • Segment

        public Segment(double x0,
               double y0,
               double x1,
               double y1)
        Constructor for an 'Segment' object
        The passed coordinates will be assigned to the internal leftPoint and rightPoint by the following rule:
        leftPoint = min(Point(x0, y0), Point(x1, y1))
        rightPoint = max(Point(x0, y0), Point(x1, y1))
        Parameters:
        x0 - - x value of first endpoint
        y0 - - y value of first endpoint
        x1 - - x value of second endpoint
        y1 - - x value of second endpoint

    • Method Detail

      • intersect

        public boolean intersect(SegmentIF other)
        Description copied from interface: SegmentIF
        Verify if this 'SegmentIF' intersects with the passed other 'SegmentIF'.
        - Intersection thru left endpoint is a valid intersection
        - Intersection thru right endpoint is not a valid intersection
        Specified by:
        intersect in interface SegmentIF
        Parameters:
        other - - the other 'SegmentIF'
        Returns:
        true - both 'SegmentIF' objects intersect each other, false - otherwise

      • isVertical

        public boolean isVertical()
        Description copied from interface: SegmentIF
        Is the alignment of this segment is vertical
        Specified by:
        isVertical in interface SegmentIF
        Returns:
        true - alignment is vertical, false otherwise

        Description copied from interface: SegmentIF
        Verify if the end points of this segment are very close to each other
        Specified by:
        isAlmostAPoint in interface SegmentIF
        Returns:
        true if the end points are very close to each other, false otherwise

      • length

        public double length(boolean useSphericalGeometry)
        Description copied from interface: SegmentIF
        Get the length of this 'SegmentIF'
        Specified by:
        length in interface SegmentIF
        Parameters:
        useSphericalGeometry - - if true spherical geometry is used to calculate the length in metres, otherwise euclidean distance is used
        Returns:
        euclidean or geographical length, depends on parameter useSphericalGeometry
